meanings.definition: The act of piercing or impaling with a sharp object.
meanings.sent1: The transfixion of the needle into the fabric was precise.
meanings.sent2: The warrior's sword transfixion was swift and accurate.
meanings.sent3: The tailor's accidental transfixion of his own finger caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze was a transfixion, piercing through the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The transfixion of the arrow into the target was met with cheers.

meanings.definition: The state of being motionless or fixed in place due to shock or awe.
meanings.sent1: The audience sat in transfixion as the magician performed his tricks.
meanings.sent2: Her transfixion at the breathtaking view held her in place.
meanings.sent3: The cat's transfixion on the moving laser dot was entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still in the transfixion of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The transfixion of the statue's beauty left everyone speechless.
